name: concatenated_binary_lexmin
author: 姜迅驰
summary: Given an integer n, arrange the numbers 1 to n in a permutation P such that the concatenation of their binary representations, S = f(P₁) + f(P₂) + ... + f(Pₙ), has the smallest possible lexicographical order. The goal is to compute the number of '1's in the first k bits of this string S. The solution leverages properties of infinite binary string comparisons and high-precision arithmetic to efficiently determine the optimal arrangement and answer queries without full construction.
